alert.note: Alert for Garfield (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 03 at 8:11AM MDT until June 04 at 1:00AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following county, Garfield. * WHEN...Until 215 PM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 809 AM MDT, Garfield County Sheriffs have reported rising water on the Big Dry Creek. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rain is expected through the day. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jordan, Brusett, Edwards, Steve Fork and Van Norman. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
